events.name: TGIFHacks #57 - Building real-time chat app w/ Firebase
events.description:
Ever wondered how to build a real-time chat app like Whatsapp and Facebook Messenger? It's not that hard! In this workshop, we'll be building a real-time chat Android app with Firebase under 2 hours. We will be using Firebase for authentication, real-time database, Firebase built-in storage and Firebase Cloud Messaging (formerly, GCM). The screenshots of this app that we'll build are attached.

By attending this workshop, you will learn how to utilize Firebase in your own project to create powerful applications and websites in less time!

Before you come to the workshop, make sure you have Android Studio installed!
events.location: The Nest Theatre @ Innovation Centre, , Singapore 63

events.name: Friday Hacks #123: Why Go For Go!
events.description:
This week we have Jordan and Shekhar from TradeGecko talking about the benefits of using Go, and it’s utility in a range of problem domains, including microservice based architectures. See you there!

Date/Time: Friday, October 28 at 6:45pm 
Venue: SR3, Town Plaza, University Town 
Free pizza is served before the talks. 

Why Go For Go!

Talk Description:

The Go Programming Language - often referred to as GoLang - was launched by Google in 2007. Co-created by Ken Thompson (co-creator of Unix and creator of B, the predecessor to C), Rob Pike, and Robert Griesemer, Go has been growing in popularity year-after-year.

We believe that there are good reasons for Go’s growing popularity and believe you should seriously consider it as the next programming language you learn.

In this talk, we will cover the benefits provided by Go and why we like it for a range of problem domains, including microservice based architectures.

Speaker Profile

Jordan Dea-Mattson 

Jordan is the VP of Software Engineering at TradeGecko. He has over 35 years of experience with many of them in Silicon Valley. He has worked for Silicon Valley icons including Apple, Adobe, Yahoo, as well as startups including IMPAC Medical Systems, Numenta, and Ooyala. Jordan has emigrated to Singapore from the US and wants to help build a world class software engineering community in Singapore. When he isn’t working, Jordan trains for triathlons and road races.

Shekhar Raju 

Shekhar leads Mobile engineering at TradeGecko. He graduated from the National University of Singapore in 2015 with a major in Computer Engineering and a minor in Business and has been with TradeGecko ever since. He previously also interned at Apple and TradeGecko. Shekhar is passionate about iOS, mapping, startups and travel.

Our Sponsors

Friday Hacks is sponsored by NUS Enterprise.
events.location: SR3, Town Plaza, University Town, NUS, , Singapore

events.name: GCP Data Protection Show Case & GCP Machine learning Demonstration
events.description: Hello Everybody, Having challenges in backing up data to cloud securely? Google Cloud Storage is here to help! It’s a simple and cost-effective Object Storage in the Cloud to address customer's data protection and storage requirements. So let’s come together for this knowledge sharing session to find out more about the best practice of modern data protection solutions to accelerate organization's business transformation while addressing security and availability concern. Furthermore, we will also conduct an interactive demo session for you to experience more on Google Cloud Backup and Vision API. RSVP now! To join us for an informative and interactive evening! *THERE WILL BE FOOD & BEVERAGES AFTER EVENTS.  ----------------------REGISTRATION CLOSED---------------- *Note that due to security of office premise, only members who filled up this Google form will be allowed for entry. Agenda:6.30 PM: Registration @ Entrance 7.00 PM: GCP Data Protection Show Case by GCP certified consultant, Lawrence Tay 7.30 PM: GCP Machine Learning Demonstration by GCP certified consultant, Lawrence Tay 8:00 PM: F&B session / Network Session 9:00 PM: End of Events Description:1. Application Data Protection to GCP - Extend your application workloads to the cloud securely with cloud-integrated storage which supports both Cloud Storage Standard and Cloud Storage Nearline. 2. GCP Machine Learning Demonstration - Understanding the content of an image has been made easier with Google Cloud Vision API which performs label detection, face detection, landmark detection and even explicit content detection. Hope to see you there!
events.location: Mapletree business City II , 70 Pasir Panjang Road #03-01 Singapore 117371
events.group_name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.name: Future Fridays: Moving Up, Moving Out
events.description:
One of the motivations for volunteers is skills: either the opportunity to learn new skills, or the opportunity to contribute our skills. However, planning meaningful opportunities for learning and leadership can be challenging. In this session, we will be exploring how we might as volunteer managers plan opportunities for our volunteers to grow within the organisation, and how we might support our volunteers as their aspirations lead them to start projects of their own. 

Thank you to Southeast CDC for being our venue partner! 

==

October is all about the Future of Giving! Sustainable Living Lab and (these)abilities will be examining the trends affecting what motivates volunteers, experimenting with different messages to engage them and exploring how cutting edge technologies can help create strong volunteer relationships. Whether you are a volunteer, a volunteer manager or simply curious, you can’t miss this! At the end of this series, we hope that you will understand and be inspired by the principles behind inclusive design. We also hope that whether you are a volunteer or a volunteer manager you will walk away with a toolkit that will help you to manage volunteer relationships better.

Write us at chewlin.kay@sl2square.org if you are joining us!
events.location: South East CDC - Your Social Broker, 10 Eunos Road 8, #12-01, Singapore Post Centre 408600
